Key Match Events: The Knicks beat the Nets twice in three days.
New York hosted Brooklyn on Friday and narrowly escaped a fourth-quarter scare.
The Knicks defeated the Nets on Sunday with a final score of 114-104.
Post-Match Reflections: Tom Thibodeau commented on the difficulty of playing the same team twice in three days and praised the team's rebounding and defense.
Tom Thibodeau reflected on Karl-Anthony Towns' career and his steady improvement.
Tom Thibodeau praised OG Anunoby's offensive contributions and Jalen Brunson's resilience despite shooting struggles.
Josh Hart appreciated the team's talent and the ability to win without relying solely on Jalen Brunson's scoring.
Karl-Anthony Towns expressed his determination to play despite a fall and possible back injury.
Karl-Anthony Towns reflected on his career evolution and childhood idol, Magic Johnson.
OG Anunoby mentioned leading in dunks for non-centers this season.
Jordi Fernandez, Brooklyn Nets Head Coach, discussed dealing with Karl-Anthony Towns.
Cam Johnson, Brooklyn Nets player, highlighted the impact of Karl-Anthony Towns' scoring in the third quarter.
Tom Crean, former college coach, praised OG Anunoby's potential and physical condition.
Tom Crean commented on the Knicks' roster adjustments and their potential as true contenders in the East.
